holidays.name: National Margarita Day
holidays.description: A day celebrated by enjoying the classic tequila-based cocktail made with lime juice, triple sec, and salt on the rim of the glass. It's a fiesta in every sip!
holidays.origin: Popularized in the US by cocktail enthusiasts and bars to celebrate this beloved drink, especially in festive or wintery months.
holidays.funFact: The Margarita is said to have been invented accidentally for a customer allergic to many spirits, and has since become one of the most popular cocktails worldwide.

holidays.name: World Thinking Day
holidays.description: An international day where Girl Guides and Girl Scouts around the world think about their peers, promote global friendship, and fundraise for worldwide causes.
holidays.origin: Started in 1926 to coincide with the birthday of Lord Baden-Powell and his wife, founders of the scouting movement.
holidays.funFact: The theme of World Thinking Day changes yearly, focusing on issues like equality, climate, and education that engage young people globally.

holidays.name: Conditional Service Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the 1983 Supreme Court ruling that allowed members of the military to receive 'conditional service' status, acknowledging unique service terms.
holidays.origin: Honors a specific legal and military policy evolution in the United States.
holidays.funFact: Conditional Service Day remains obscure but highlights how military laws adapt to changing needs and circumstances.
